ground_truth: An uneasy silence descends, during which Mrs. Bennet winks at Kitty and Lizzie, gesturing to Jane and Mr. Bingley. Kitty glances at Jane, then at her mother, in confusion. She nods to Mr. Bingley, then leaves the room, followed by Mary and Kitty. Once they have left, Mr. Bingley sits back down. Lizzie casually takes up her embroidery, turning slightly to afford Mr. Bingley and Jane some privacy. Lizzie puts down her embroidery, smiles at Mr. Bingley, then leaves the room. She gives Jane a warning glance as she leaves. Mr. Bingley looks nervously down at Jane, who eventually raises her eyes demurely to meet his. An anxious Mrs. Bennet and the rest of the girls are sitting in another room, waiting. Mrs. Bennet sits with a smug expression. Moments later, Lizzie is skipping quietly down the stairs. She treads silently up to the door of the parlor, then walks inside to find her sister and Mr. Bingley standing together at the mantelpiece. Mr. Bingley leans in and whispers something to Jane, then takes his leave. Lizzie immediately turns to her sister. She kisses her sister on the cheek, then leaves the room. When she's gone, Lizzie's broad smile turns to an expression of contented relief. A little later, Mr. Bennet and the rest of the family are seeing Mr. Bingley out. Mr. Bingley smiles briefly at Jane, then climbs up onto his white horse. Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief at him as Mr. Bingley sets off. Mr. Bennet stands next to Jane. As they all head inside, Jane hangs back for a moment and turns to Lizzie. They walk indoors together arm in arm. An elegant carriage is arriving at Longbourn, complete with four horses and liveried footmen. Seeing this, Kitty quickly runs over to the house. Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter, Anne, are inside the carriage. She points over to the window and Lizzie and her mother quickly hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside, Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet all curtsy. With a haughty expression, she marches over to take a seat. Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, looking at her with a certain amount of expectant unease. Lady Catherine heads out and Lizzie follows her, looking puzzled. Now, they're out in a less well-tended area of the garden, Lady Catherine striding ahead, with Lizzie a couple of paces behind her. She marches over to a clearing under a tree, bounded by two small stone benches, then turns to Lizzie. Relief floods Lady Catherine's face. She climbs into her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. The carriage departs. Lizzie watches it go, her expression giving little away. She then turns indoors.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A nervous quietness falls, during which Mrs. Bennet blinks at Kitty and Lizzie, gesturing to Jane and Mr. Bingley. Kitty peeks at Jane, then at her mother, in bafflement. She acknowledges Mr. Bingley, then exits the room, followed by Mary and Kitty. Once they have departed, Mr. Bingley reclines back. Lizzie nonchalantly picks up her needlework, shifting slightly to allow Mr. Bingley and Jane some seclusion. Lizzie places down her needlework, grins at Mr. Bingley, then departs the room. She gives Jane a cautionary glance as she departs. Mr. Bingley gazes apprehensively down at Jane, who eventually lifts her eyes modestly to meet his. A worried Mrs. Bennet and the rest of the girls are sitting in another room, awaiting. Mrs. Bennet is seated with a self-satisfied expression. Moments afterward, Lizzie is bouncing quietly down the stairs. She steps silently up to the entrance of the parlor, then strides inside to find her sister and Mr. Bingley standing together at the fireplace. Mr. Bingley inclines in and murmurs something to Jane, then makes his departure. Lizzie instantly turns to her sister. She pecks her sister on the cheek, then exits the room. When she's gone, Lizzie's wide grin turns to a look of satisfied relief. A little afterward, Mr. Bennet and the rest of the household are accompanying Mr. Bingley out. Mr. Bingley beams briefly at Jane, then mounts up onto his white steed. Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief at him as Mr. Bingley sets off. Mr. Bennet stands beside Jane. As they all proceed inside, Jane lingers back for a moment and turns to Lizzie. They walk indoors together arm in arm. A sophisticated carriage is arriving at Longbourn, complete with four steeds and uniformed servants. Observing this, Kitty swiftly dashes over to the abode. Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her offspring, Anne, are inside the carriage. She gestures over to the window and Lizzie and her mother quickly hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside, Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet all curtsy. With an arrogant expression, she strides over to take a seat. Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, looking at her with a certain amount of expectant anxiety. Lady Catherine heads out and Lizzie trails her, looking bewildered. Now, they're out in a less well-maintained section of the garden, Lady Catherine pacing ahead, with Lizzie a couple of steps behind her. She strides over to a clearing under a tree, bordered by two small stone benches, then pivots to Lizzie. Relief inundates Lady Catherine's face. She enters her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with indignation. The carriage departs. Lizzie watches it go, her expression revealing little. She then turns indoors.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence is descended upon, during which Kitty and Lizzie are winked at by Mrs. Bennet, with gestures made towards Jane and Mr. Bingley. Jane and her mother, in confusion, are glanced at by Kitty. Mr. Bingley is nodded to by her, and the room is left by her, followed by Mary and Kitty. Once they have left, Mr. Bingley resumes his seat. Her embroidery is casually taken up by Lizzie, and she turns slightly to afford Mr. Bingley and Jane some privacy. Her embroidery is put down by Lizzie, she smiles at Mr. Bingley, then the room is left by her. A warning glance is given to Jane by her as she leaves. Nervously, Mr. Bingley looks down at Jane, who eventually raises her eyes demurely to meet his. The rest of the girls and Mrs. Bennet wait anxiously, sitting in another room. A smug expression is worn by Mrs. Bennet as she sits. Moments later, Lizzie quietly skips down the stairs. She silently treads up to the parlor door, then enters to find her sister and Mr. Bingley standing together at the mantelpiece. Mr. Bingley leans in and whispers something to Jane, then he leaves. Immediately, Lizzie turns to her sister. Her sister is kissed on the cheek by her, then she leaves the room. Her broad smile turns to an expression of contented relief when she's gone. A little later, Mr. Bingley is seen out by Mr. Bennet and the rest of the family. A brief smile is given to Jane by Mr. Bingley, then he climbs up onto his white horse. Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief at him as he sets off. Next to Jane stands Mr. Bennet. As they all head inside, Jane hangs back momentarily and turns to Lizzie. Together, arm in arm, they walk indoors. An elegant carriage arrives at Longbourn, complete with four horses and liveried footmen. Kitty quickly runs over to the house upon seeing this. Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter, Anne, are inside the carriage. Over to the window is pointed by her, and Lizzie and her mother quickly hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside, curtsies are performed by Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet. With a haughty expression, she marches over to take a seat. Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, looking at her with a certain amount of expectant unease. Lady Catherine heads out, followed by Lizzie, who looks puzzled. Now, they are out in a less well-tended area of the garden, with Lady Catherine striding ahead, Lizzie a couple of paces behind her. Over to a clearing under a tree, bounded by two small stone benches, she marches, then turns to Lizzie. Relief floods her face. Into her carriage, Lady Catherine climbs, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. The carriage departs. As Lizzie watches it go, her expression gives little away. Indoors, she then turns.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence falls as Mrs. Bennet winks at Kitty and Lizzie, gesturing to Jane and Mr. Bingley. Kitty looks at Jane, then her mother, confused. She nods to Mr. Bingley and exits, followed by Mary and Kitty. After they leave, Mr. Bingley sits. Lizzie resumes her embroidery, turning to give Mr. Bingley and Jane privacy. She smiles at Mr. Bingley, then exits, giving Jane a warning glance. Mr. Bingley looks nervously at Jane, who eventually meets his gaze. An anxious Mrs. Bennet and the girls wait in another room, Mrs. Bennet smug. Moments later, Lizzie quietly descends the stairs, enters the parlor, and finds Jane and Mr. Bingley at the mantelpiece. Mr. Bingley whispers to Jane, then departs. Lizzie kisses Jane's cheek and leaves, her smile turning to contented relief. Later, Mr. Bennet and the family see Mr. Bingley out. He smiles at Jane, mounts his white horse, and departs as Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief. Mr. Bennet stands by Jane. As they head inside, Jane lingers, then joins Lizzie arm in arm. An elegant carriage with four horses and footmen arrives at Longbourn. Kitty runs to the house. Lady Catherine de Bourgh and Anne are inside. She points to the window, and Lizzie and her mother hurry to see. Lady Catherine enters, and Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet curtsy. With a haughty look, she takes a seat. Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet stand, expectantly uneasy. Lady Catherine leaves, and Lizzie follows, puzzled. In a less tended garden area, Lady Catherine strides ahead, Lizzie behind. At a clearing with stone benches, Lady Catherine turns to Lizzie, relief on her face. She enters her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. The carriage departs, and Lizzie watches, expression neutral, then turns indoors.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence falls as Mrs. Bennet winks at Kitty and Lizzie, gesturing to Jane and Mr. Bingley. Confused, Kitty glances at Jane and her mother, nods to Mr. Bingley, and leaves with Mary. Mr. Bingley sits, and Lizzie resumes her embroidery, giving them privacy. She smiles at Mr. Bingley, leaves, and warns Jane with a glance. Mr. Bingley looks nervously at Jane, who meets his gaze. Anxious Mrs. Bennet and the girls wait in another room. Lizzie quietly enters the parlor, finding Jane and Mr. Bingley at the mantelpiece. He whispers to Jane and leaves. Lizzie kisses Jane, leaves, and smiles contentedly. Later, the family sees Mr. Bingley off. He smiles at Jane, mounts his horse, and departs as Mrs. Bennet waves. Mr. Bennet stands by Jane, who lingers and turns to Lizzie. They walk inside arm in arm. An elegant carriage with Lady Catherine de Bourgh and Anne arrives. Kitty runs to the house. Lizzie and Mrs. Bennet hurry to the window. Lady Catherine enters, and they curtsy. With a haughty look, she sits while they stand expectantly. Lady Catherine leaves, and Lizzie follows, puzzled. In the garden, Lady Catherine strides ahead to a clearing, turns to Lizzie, and departs, leaving Lizzie angry. The carriage leaves, and Lizzie watches, expressionless, then goes inside.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A tense and uneasy silence descends upon the room, during which Mrs. Bennet, with a knowing look, winks at her daughters, Kitty and Lizzie, subtly gesturing towards Jane and Mr. Bingley. Kitty, caught off guard, glances first at Jane and then at her mother, her face a picture of confusion. She gives a small nod to Mr. Bingley before quietly exiting the room, with Mary and Kitty following closely behind her. Once they have all left, Mr. Bingley, feeling more at ease, sits back down. Lizzie, in a casual manner, picks up her embroidery, turning slightly to provide Mr. Bingley and Jane with a semblance of privacy. After a moment, Lizzie sets her embroidery aside, offers Mr. Bingley a warm smile, and then gracefully leaves the room. As she departs, she casts a cautionary glance at Jane. Mr. Bingley, feeling a mix of nerves and anticipation, looks down at Jane, who eventually raises her eyes in a demure manner to meet his gaze. Meanwhile, an anxious Mrs. Bennet, along with the rest of the girls, sits in another room, waiting with bated breath. Mrs. Bennet, however, wears a smug expression, confident in her matchmaking efforts. Moments later, Lizzie is seen skipping quietly down the stairs. She treads silently up to the door of the parlor and then walks inside, where she finds her sister and Mr. Bingley standing together at the mantelpiece. Mr. Bingley leans in, whispers something softly to Jane, and then takes his leave. Lizzie immediately turns to her sister, planting a gentle kiss on her cheek before leaving the room. Once she's gone, Lizzie's broad smile transforms into an expression of contented relief. A little while later, Mr. Bennet and the rest of the family gather to see Mr. Bingley out. Mr. Bingley offers a brief, warm smile to Jane before climbing up onto his majestic white horse. Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief enthusiastically at him as Mr. Bingley sets off. Mr. Bennet stands beside Jane, and as they all head back inside, Jane lingers for a moment, turning to Lizzie. They walk indoors together, arm in arm, sharing a sisterly bond. Meanwhile, an elegant carriage arrives at Longbourn, complete with four stately horses and liveried footmen. Upon seeing this, Kitty quickly runs over to the house. Inside the carriage are Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter, Anne. Lady Catherine points towards the window, prompting Lizzie and her mother to hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside, Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet all curtsy respectfully. With a haughty expression, Lady Catherine marches over to take a seat, while Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, looking at her with a mix of expectation and unease. Lady Catherine eventually heads out, and Lizzie follows her, her expression puzzled. Now, they find themselves in a less well-tended area of the garden, with Lady Catherine striding ahead and Lizzie a couple of paces behind. Lady Catherine marches over to a clearing under a tree, bounded by two small stone benches, and then turns to face Lizzie. Relief floods Lady Catherine's face as she climbs into her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. The carriage departs, and Lizzie watches it go, her expression revealing little of her inner turmoil. She then turns and heads indoors.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A tense and strained, almost palpable silence descends upon the room. During this moment of uneasy quiet, Mrs. Bennet, with a knowing and slightly conspiratorial look, winks at her daughters, Kitty and Lizzie, subtly gesturing with a hint of urgency towards Jane and the ever-charming Mr. Bingley. Kitty, evidently caught off guard and slightly flustered by her mother's silent communication, glances first at Jane, then shifts her bewildered gaze to her mother, her expression a perfect picture of confusion. She gives a small, awkward nod of acknowledgment to Mr. Bingley before quietly making her exit from the room. Mary and Kitty follow closely behind her, leaving the space somewhat emptier. Once they have all vacated the room, Mr. Bingley, now feeling more at ease and less self-conscious, sits back down, relaxing slightly into his seat. Lizzie, in a casual yet deliberate manner, picks up her embroidery and turns her body slightly, providing Mr. Bingley and Jane with a semblance of privacy. After a thoughtful moment, Lizzie sets her embroidery aside on a nearby table, offers Mr. Bingley a warm and reassuring smile, and then gracefully leaves the room, gliding toward the door. As she departs, she casts a meaningful and cautionary glance back at Jane. Mr. Bingley, experiencing a blend of nerves and hopeful anticipation, looks down at Jane, who eventually raises her eyes in a demure and gentle manner to meet his gaze. Meanwhile, an anxious Mrs. Bennet, along with the rest of the girls, sits in another room, waiting restlessly, almost breathlessly. Mrs. Bennet, however, wears a smug and self-satisfied expression, confident in the effectiveness of her matchmaking efforts. Moments later, Lizzie is seen skipping quietly down the stairs. Her steps are light and cautious as she treads silently up to the door of the parlor and then walks inside, where she finds her sister Jane and Mr. Bingley standing together near the mantelpiece. Mr. Bingley leans in and whispers something softly to Jane before taking his leave. Lizzie immediately approaches her sister, planting a gentle kiss on her cheek before once again leaving the room. Once she's gone, Lizzie's broad smile transforms into an expression of contented relief. A little while later, Mr. Bennet and the rest of the family gather to see Mr. Bingley out. Mr. Bingley offers a brief, warm smile to Jane before climbing up onto his majestic white horse. Mrs. Bennet enthusiastically waves her handkerchief at him as Mr. Bingley sets off on his way. Mr. Bennet stands protectively beside Jane, and as they all head back inside, Jane lingers for a moment, turning to Lizzie. They walk indoors together, arm in arm, sharing a sisterly bond and mutual understanding. Meanwhile, an elegant carriage arrives at Longbourn, complete with four stately horses and liveried footmen, their attire immaculate. Upon seeing this, Kitty quickly runs over to the house. Inside the luxurious carriage are Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter, Anne. Lady Catherine points towards the window, prompting Lizzie and her mother to hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside, Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet all curtsy respectfully. With a haughty expression, Lady Catherine marches over with authority to take a seat, while Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, looking at her with a mix of expectation and unease. Lady Catherine eventually heads out, and Lizzie follows her, her expression one of puzzlement and contemplation. Now, they find themselves in a less well-tended area of the garden, with Lady Catherine striding ahead purposefully and Lizzie a couple of paces behind. Lady Catherine marches decisively over to a clearing under a tree, bounded by two small stone benches, and turns to face Lizzie. Relief floods Lady Catherine's face as she climbs into her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with unresolved anger. The carriage departs, and Lizzie watches it go, her expression carefully revealing little of her inner turmoil. She then turns and heads indoors, her mind still racing with thoughts and emotions.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence descends upon the room, during which Mrs. Bennet discreetly winks at Kitty and Lizzie, subtly gesturing towards Jane and Mr. Bingley to draw their attention. Kitty, feeling a bit confused, glances first at Jane and then back at her mother, trying to understand the silent communication. She acknowledges Mr. Bingley with a nod before deciding to leave the room, with Mary and Kitty following her lead. As soon as they have exited, Mr. Bingley takes the opportunity to sit back down, settling into his seat. Meanwhile, Lizzie casually picks up her embroidery, adjusting her position slightly to give Mr. Bingley and Jane a semblance of privacy. After a moment, Lizzie sets her embroidery aside, offers Mr. Bingley a friendly smile, and then exits the room, casting a cautionary glance at Jane as she departs. Mr. Bingley, feeling a mix of nerves and anticipation, looks down at Jane, who eventually lifts her eyes in a demure manner to meet his gaze. In another room, an anxious Mrs. Bennet, along with the rest of the girls, sits waiting, with Mrs. Bennet wearing a smug expression of satisfaction. Moments later, Lizzie is seen skipping quietly down the stairs, moving with a light step. She approaches the door of the parlor silently, then enters to find her sister and Mr. Bingley standing together at the mantelpiece. Mr. Bingley leans in close to Jane, whispering something softly before taking his leave. Lizzie immediately turns her attention to her sister, planting a kiss on her cheek before leaving the room. Once outside, Lizzie's broad smile transforms into an expression of contented relief. A little later, Mr. Bennet and the rest of the family gather to see Mr. Bingley off. Mr. Bingley offers Jane a brief smile before mounting his white horse. As he sets off, Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief in farewell, while Mr. Bennet stands beside Jane. As the family heads back inside, Jane lingers for a moment, turning to Lizzie, and they walk indoors together, arm in arm. Meanwhile, an elegant carriage arrives at Longbourn, drawn by four horses and attended by liveried footmen. Upon seeing this, Kitty quickly dashes over to the house. Inside the carriage are Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter, Anne. Lady Catherine points towards the window, prompting Lizzie and her mother to hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside, Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet all perform a curtsy. With a haughty expression, Lady Catherine strides over to take a seat, while Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, watching her with a mix of expectation and unease. Lady Catherine eventually heads out, and Lizzie follows her, looking puzzled by the encounter. They find themselves in a less well-tended area of the garden, with Lady Catherine striding ahead and Lizzie trailing a couple of paces behind. Lady Catherine marches over to a clearing under a tree, bordered by two small stone benches, and turns to face Lizzie. Relief washes over Lady Catherine's face as she climbs into her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. As the carriage departs, Lizzie watches it go, her expression remaining inscrutable. She then turns and makes her way back indoors.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence falls as Mrs. Bennet winks at Kitty and Lizzie, gesturing toward Jane and Mr. Bingley. Confused, Kitty glances between Jane and her mother before nodding to Mr. Bingley and leaving the room with Mary. Once alone, Mr. Bingley sits back down, and Lizzie discreetly resumes her embroidery to give him and Jane some privacy. After a moment, Lizzie sets aside her embroidery, smiles at Mr. Bingley, and exits, giving Jane a cautionary glance. Mr. Bingley nervously looks at Jane, who eventually meets his gaze. Meanwhile, Mrs. Bennet and the other girls wait anxiously in another room, with Mrs. Bennet looking smug. Lizzie soon returns, quietly entering the parlor to find Jane and Mr. Bingley at the mantelpiece. After Mr. Bingley whispers to Jane and departs, Lizzie kisses her sister on the cheek and leaves, her smile turning to contented relief. Later, the family sees Mr. Bingley off as he smiles at Jane and mounts his horse. Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief as he rides away. Mr. Bennet stands by Jane, and as they head inside, Jane lingers to join Lizzie, walking arm in arm. An elegant carriage arrives at Longbourn, prompting Kitty to rush to the house. Inside the carriage are Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter, Anne. Lizzie and her mother hurry to the window as Lady Catherine enters. They curtsy as she takes a seat with a haughty expression, leaving them standing with expectant unease. Lady Catherine then heads outside, with Lizzie following, puzzled. In a less tended garden area, Lady Catherine strides to a clearing under a tree and turns to Lizzie. Relief washes over Lady Catherine as she departs in her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. Lizzie watches the carriage leave, her expression neutral, before turning indoors.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence descends, during which Mrs. Bennet, ever eager to see her daughters married well according to the social aspirations of the time, winks at Kitty and Lizzie, gesturing to Jane and Mr. Bingley. Kitty glances at Jane, whose beauty had long been noted in Hertfordshire society, then at her mother, in confusion. She nods to Mr. Bingley, who had recently rented Netherfield Park to much local excitement, then leaves the room, followed by Mary and Kitty. Once they have left, Mr. Bingley sits back down. Lizzie casually takes up her embroidery, a popular pastime for ladies seeking both to display and cultivate their domestic skills, turning slightly to afford Mr. Bingley and Jane some privacy. Lizzie puts down her embroidery, smiles at Mr. Bingley, then leaves the room. She gives Jane a warning glance as she leaves, fully aware of how crucial this moment is. Mr. Bingley looks nervously down at Jane, who eventually raises her eyes demurely to meet his, her shyness contrasting with the boldness of Mrs. Bennet's matchmaking. An anxious Mrs. Bennet and the rest of the girls are sitting in another room, waiting. Mrs. Bennet sits with a smug expression, anticipating the success of her machinations. Moments later, Lizzie is skipping quietly down the stairs of their modest yet comfortable home. She treads silently up to the door of the parlor, then walks inside to find her sister and Mr. Bingley standing together at the mantelpiece, a traditional spot for intimate conversations. Mr. Bingley leans in and whispers something to Jane, then takes his leave, as gentlemen were wont to maintain propriety despite their emotions. Lizzie immediately turns to her sister. She kisses her sister on the cheek, then leaves the room. When she's gone, Lizzie's broad smile turns to an expression of contented relief, knowing Jane's happiness seems assured. A little later, Mr. Bennet and the rest of the family are seeing Mr. Bingley out. Mr. Bingley smiles briefly at Jane, then climbs up onto his white horse, a sign of his gentlemanly status. Mrs. Bennet waves her handkerchief at him as Mr. Bingley sets off. Mr. Bennet stands next to Jane, his quiet demeanor belying his relief for her future well-being. As they all head inside, Jane hangs back for a moment and turns to Lizzie. They walk indoors together arm in arm, sharing a sisterly bond strengthened by the day's events. An elegant carriage is arriving at Longbourn, the Bennet family estate, complete with four horses and liveried footmen. Seeing this, Kitty quickly runs over to the house. Lady Catherine de Bourgh, renowned for her formidable presence and wealth, and her daughter, Anne, are inside the carriage. She points over to the window and Lizzie and her mother quickly hurry over to see for themselves, knowing Lady Catherine's visits often carried important, if not always welcome, news. As Lady Catherine steps inside, Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet all curtsy, observing the reverence due to her aristocratic status. With a haughty expression, she marches over to take a seat, her demeanor commanding the room. Lizzie, Kitty, and Mrs. Bennet remain standing, looking at her with a certain amount of expectant unease, their awareness of her potential to disrupt their lives palpable. Lady Catherine heads out and Lizzie follows her, looking puzzled by the unexpected visit. Now, they're out in a less well-tended area of the garden, the wildness of the shrubs contrasting with Lady Catherine's structured control, striding ahead, with Lizzie a couple of paces behind her. She marches over to a clearing under a tree, bounded by two small stone benches, then turns to Lizzie, the setting creating a private space for their confrontation. Relief floods Lady Catherine's face upon achieving her aim. She climbs into her carriage, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger, her frustration at the interference in her life simmering beneath the surface. The carriage departs, its opulence speaking to her influence. Lizzie watches it go, her expression giving little away, her mind racing with the implications of the visit. She then turns indoors, preparing to share the encounter with her family.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Mr Bennet stands next to Jane. As they all head inside Jane hangs back for a moment and turns to Lizzie. They walk indoors together arm in arm. An elegant carriage is arriving at Longbourn complete with four horses and liveried footmen. Seeing this Kitty quickly runs over to the house. Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter Anne are inside the carriage. She points over to the window and Lizzie and her mother quickly hurry over to see for themselves. As Lady Catherine steps inside Lizzie Kitty and Mrs Bennet all curtsy. With a haughty expression she marches over to take a seat. Lizzie Kitty and Mrs Bennet remain standing looking at her with a certain amount of expectant unease. Lady Catherine heads out and Lizzie follows her looking puzzled. Now they are out in a less welltended area of the garden. Lady Catherine striding ahead with Lizzie a couple of paces behind her. She marches over to a clearing under a tree bounded by two small stone benches then turns to Lizzie. Relief floods Lady Catherine's face. She climbs into her carriage leaving Lizzie breathless with anger. The carriage departs. Lizzie watches it go her expression giving little away. She then turns indoors.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence descends during which Mrs Bennet winks at Kitty and Lizzie gesturing to Jane and Mr Bingley. Kitty glances at Jane then at her mother in confusion. She nods to Mr Bingley then leaves the room followed by Mary and Kitty. Once they have left Mr Bingley sits back down. Lizzie casually takes up her embroidery turning slightly to afford Mr Bingley and Jane some privacy. Lizzie puts down her embroidery smiles at Mr Bingley then leaves the room. She gives Jane a warning glance as she leaves. Mr Bingley looks nervously down at Jane who eventually raises her eyes demurely to meet his. An anxious Mrs Bennet and the rest of the girls are sitting in another room waiting. Mrs Bennet sits with a smug expression. Moments later Lizzie is skipping quietly down the stairs. She treads silently up to the door of the parlor then walks inside to find her sister and Mr Bingley standing together at the mantelpiece. Mr Bingley leans in and whispers something to Jane then takes his leave. Lizzie immediately turns to her sister. She kisses her sister on the cheek then leaves the room. When she is gone Lizzie's broad smile turns to an expression of contented relief. A little later Mr Bennet and the rest of the family are seeing Mr Bingley out. Mr Bingley smiles briefly at Jane then climbs up onto his white horse. Mrs Bennet waves her handkerchief at him as Mr Bingley sets off. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A peaceful melody rises, during which Mr. Smith chuckles at Timmy and Lulu, gesturing to Sam and Dr. Howard. Timmy grins at Sam, then at his uncle, in delight. He waves to Dr. Howard, then enters the garden, followed by Sandy and Timmy. Once they have arrived, Dr. Howard stands up. Lulu quietly picks up her violin, tilting slightly to grant Dr. Howard and Sam some solitude. Lulu places down her violin, winks at Dr. Howard, then enters the garden. She gives Sam a playful grin as she arrives. Dr. Howard glances shyly up at Sam, who eventually lowers his gaze coyly to greet hers. A cheerful Mr. Smith and the rest of the boys are lying on another lawn, sleeping. Mr. Smith lies with a content expression. Moments earlier, Lulu was jogging loudly across the attic. She hops noisily down to the gate of the barn, then runs outside to find her brother and Dr. Howard lying separately by the window seat. Dr. Howard stands up and shouts something to Sam, then takes his seat. Lulu instantly laughs to her brother. She hugs her brother on the neck, then enters the garden. When she's staying, Lulu's narrow frown transforms to an expression of puzzled satisfaction. A little earlier, Mrs. Smith and the remainder of the crew are following Dr. Howard in. Dr. Howard frowns briefly at Sam, then slides down onto his black bicycle. Mr. Smith throws his glove at him as Dr. Howard pedals away. Mrs. Smith sits far from Sam. As they all wait outside, Sam rushes forward for a moment and dances to Lulu. They skip outdoors separately back to back. A rough airship is departing from Meryton, complete with six elephants and armored knights. Noticing this, Timmy lazily strolls away from the pond. Lord Kensington and his nephew, Marcus, are riding the airship. He yells away from the yard and Lulu and her uncle lazily wander away to hide from themselves. As Lord Kensington leaps outside, Lulu, Timmy, and Mr. Smith all kneel. With a humble expression, he slithers away to avoid a nap. Lulu, Timmy, and Mr. Smith keep sitting, sleeping away from him with a huge amount of satisfied contentment. Lord Kensington sticks around and Lulu trails him, looking relieved. Now, they're in a more delightful section of the forest, Lord Kensington dancing near, with Lulu several steps ahead of him. She tiptoes away from a river under a cloud, surrounded by three large wooden beds, then spins away from Lulu. Excitement drains Lord Kensington's arm. He skips out of his airship, leaving Lulu frozen with delight. The airship withdraws. Lulu hears it come, her expression hiding everything. She then smiles outside.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: An uneasy silence falls as Mrs. Bennet signals to Kitty and Lizzie about Jane and Mr. Bingley. Kitty, confused, nods to Mr. Bingley and exits with Mary. Once alone, Mr. Bingley sits with Jane while Lizzie picks up her embroidery, gives them privacy, and exits with a warning glance at Jane. Mrs. Bennet and the others wait anxiously in another room. Returning, Lizzie finds Mr. Bingley and Jane together; he whispers to Jane and departs. Lizzie kisses Jane's cheek and leaves, her smile turning to relief. Later, the family sees Mr. Bingley off. Jane and Lizzie return inside together. An elegant carriage arrives with Lady Catherine de Bourgh and her daughter. Kitty alerts the household, and they observe as Lady Catherine takes a seat, commanding attention with a haughty demeanor. Lizzie follows Lady Catherine outside to a garden clearing. Lady Catherine departs, leaving Lizzie breathless with anger, her expression revealing little as she turns indoors.
